doc.field: Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
Series XXIII: Pride and Progress / The Right Stuff
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 62 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 173[Air Date: 12/3/1985]
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 62 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 173[Air Date: 12/3/1985]

Pride and ProgressNews-highlights:1. The American Federation of Labor CIO speaks in favor of gay rights2. Vermont gay rights victory3. David Axelrod, New York State Health Commissioner guest speaker at gay and lesbian synagogueCOMMERCIAL: National Fund for Human Dignity4. District of Columbia reinstates revenue bonds to anti-gay Georgetown University5. Dallas, Texas gay activist refuses sodomy statute oathCOMMERCIAL: Orientation '85, funded by The National Gay Task Force6. AIDS hysteria, Potential bill criminalizes AIDS transmission7. People's Republic of China protest against AIDS with travel restrictions and blood tests8. Wayne Steinman, Civil Liberties Crisis Coalition, discusses AIDS hysteriaCOMMERCIAL: "New York Native" with Quentin Crisp9. Sports, interview with Leslie Randolph, Ramblers10. Healthline: Conversations with GMHC: Fran Peltz, Group Leader of Care Partners, discusses AIDS support11. Closing credits
The Right Stuff:1. Sybil Bruncheon at Halloween celebration, Christopher StreetCOMMERCIAL: AIDS hotline, New York AIDS Action2. Sybil Bruncheon and Bill Baumer Halloween coverageCOMMERCIAL: The Monster3. Cabaret Beat, includes Hal and David clip4. Women Identified: Connie Kurtz, peer councilor, and Ruth Burman, mental health councilor, discuss the coming out process
[1]--Pride and Progress, Episode No. 62 [2]--The Right Stuff, Episode No. 173[Air Date: 12/3/1985]: December 1985
